intro: Erycibe praecipua, commonly known as the red hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from red to pink. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Erycibe praecipua is also used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
